item.title: 税收纠纷导致预算延迟，南非股市和兰特下跌
item.description: 在立法者推迟提交年度预算后，南非兰特和股市暴跌，引发了人们对自去年 5 月大选以来一直执政的联合政府稳定性的担忧。【原文：South Africa’s rand and stocks slumped after lawmakers delayed the presentation of the annual budget, raising concern about the stability of the coalition government that has governed the country since elections in May last year.】

item.title: 私募股权投资因试图剥夺投资者保护而遭到反击
item.description: 在 2025 年风起云涌的杠杆债务市场上，一切都有待商榷，但事实证明，三项投资者保护措施是贷款人不会逾越的底线。【原文：In 2025’s go-go leveraged debt markets, everything is up for negotiation, but a trio of investor protections are proving to be lines that lenders won’t cross.】

item.title: 欧盟将拨出专款保护海底电缆免遭破坏
item.description: 欧盟将加强对可能遭到破坏的数千英里海底电缆的资助和监控，以更好地保护集团的能源和数字安全。【原文：The European Union will boost funding and surveillance for thousands of miles of undersea cables at risk of sabotage, to better protect the bloc’s energy and digital security.】

item.title: 报告称，Uber、Lyft 因车费上涨 7.2% 而面临客户流失风险
item.description: 周二发布的一份报告显示，如果共享出行价格继续上涨，超过目前的水平，优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc. risk a dropoff in demand if rideshare prices continue to increase beyond current levels, according to a report released Tuesday.】

item.title: 南非民主党警告增税计划将 "摧毁 "经济
item.description: 南非民主联盟（Democratic Alliance）为其阻挠一项出人意料的提高增值税计划的决定进行了辩护，该计划迫使年度预算的提交出现了前所未有的延迟。【原文：South Africa’s Democratic Alliance defended its decision to obstruct a surprise plan to hike value-added tax, forcing an unprecedented delay in the presentation of the annual budget.】

item.title: Gramercy 目标 10 亿美元用于土耳其私人信贷投资
item.description: Gramercy Funds Management 公司计划在未来 24 个月内完成 10 亿美元的土耳其私人信贷交易，这是该公司直接向新兴市场公司提供贷款战略的一部分。【原文：Gramercy Funds Management is planning to reach $1 billion in Turkish private-credit deals in the next 24 months as part of its strategy of lending directly to emerging-market companies.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体就封口令起诉巴西最高法院法官
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的媒体公司起诉了巴西最高法院的一名法官，指控他试图非法压制巴西保守派声音在美国社交媒体上的活动。【原文：President Donald Trump’s media company sued a Brazilian Supreme Court justice, accusing him of trying to illegally suppress the US social-media activity of conservative Brazilian voices.】

item.title: 经济乐观情绪升温，阿根廷各省着眼于出售债务
item.description: 阿根廷的两个地区政府在阔别国际债券市场近十年后，正在探索重返国际债券市场，利用华尔街对阿根廷经济正在反弹、通货膨胀终于得到控制的信心。【原文：Two Argentine regional governments are exploring a return to international bond markets after a near decade-long absence, tapping into Wall Street confidence that the economy is rebounding and inflation is finally back under control.】

item.title: 美国房屋新开工量在 12 月大涨后广泛回落
item.description: 由于对抵押贷款利率和未售出房屋的担忧与日俱增，建筑商减少了单户和多户住宅的建设，美国 1 月份的房屋开工率有所放缓。【原文：US housing starts slowed in January as builders pulled back on single- and multifamily home construction amid growing worries over mortgage rates and unsold homes.】

item.title: 开普勒分析师称，伍德可能需要 4 亿美元融资
item.description: Kepler Cheuvreux 公司的一位分析师表示，约翰-伍德集团公司可能需要进行增资，增资规模几乎是这家陷入困境的英国能源工程师公司市值的两倍。【原文：John Wood Group Plc may require a capital raise that’s almost twice the size of the beleaguered British energy engineer’s market capitalization, an analyst at Kepler Cheuvreux suggested.】

item.title: 印度出口商认为美国对药品和汽车征收关税的影响有限
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普最近威胁要对汽车和药品进口征收更高的关税，印度出口商预计不会因此受到重大打击。【原文：Indian exporters don’t anticipate a major hit from US President Donald Trump’s latest threat to impose higher tariffs on automobile and pharmaceutical imports.】

item.title: 交易商愿意为泰晤士河救援贷款支付高额溢价
item.description: 泰晤士河水务公司急需在 3 月底之前获得现金，以避免破产，而投资者愿意出高价购买提供现金的机会。【原文：Thames Water desperately needs cash before the end of March in order to stave off insolvency, and investors are willing to pay over the odds for the opportunity to provide it.】

item.title: 阿波罗、HPS 与 KKR 共同参与 13 亿英镑的 Constellation 债务交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）和 HPS Investment Partners 与 KKR & Co 共同为 Constellation 汽车集团提供 13 亿英镑（16.4 亿美元）的债务。【原文：Apollo Global Management and HPS Investment Partners joined KKR & Co to provide £1.3 billion ($1.64 billion) of debt for Constellation Automotive Group, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 石油激进分子的威胁让特朗普的 "暴涨 "黯然失色
item.description:
对冲基金埃利奥特（Elliott ）最近采取的行动表明，业绩不佳的管理团队可能会被推上风口浪尖。【原文：

Recent actions by hedge fund Elliott indicate management teams that fail to perform may be in the firing line.

】

item.title: 迈克尔-赛勒在比特币上的豪赌激励着模仿者首席执行官们
item.description: 乔纳森-法拉利（Jonathan Ferrari）的送餐公司刚刚起步，投资者几乎已经将其一笔勾销。【原文：Investors had pretty much written off Jonathan Ferrari’s fledging meal-delivery company.】

item.title: 罗珀技术公司探索以 40 亿美元出售海王星设备
item.description: 据知情人士透露，罗珀科技公司（Roper Technologies Inc.【原文：Roper Technologies Inc. is exploring a sale of its Neptune Technology Group division, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 埃利奥特寻求菲利普斯 66 董事会席位，敦促出售输油管道
item.description: 埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）正在寻求炼油商菲利普斯 66 公司的董事会席位，以推动该公司出售或分拆其管道业务。【原文：Elliott Investment Management is seeking seats on the board of oil refiner Phillips 66 as it pushes the company to sell or spin off its pipeline business.】

item.title: 中国将加强对非国有企业稀土开采的管理
item.description: 中国计划禁止非国有企业开采稀土，进一步加强对这一战略行业的控制，该行业已成为中国与美国贸易战的战场。【原文：China plans to prohibit non-state companies from mining rare earths, further tightening its control over a strategic sector that has emerged as a battleground in its trade war with the US.】

item.title: 曾经炙手可热的金融科技公司如何押注人工智能导致破产
item.description: 与许多金融科技初创公司一样，Bench Accounting 公司也有雄心壮志，要改变金融业中一个枯燥但重要的角落。【原文：Bench Accounting, like many fintech startups, had ambitions to shake up a boring but important corner of finance — in this case, bookkeeping for small businesses.】

item.title: 尼古拉宣告破产，陷入困境的电动汽车制造商长期下滑的颓势宣告结束
item.description: 尼古拉公司（Nikola Corp.）申请破产，使这家电动汽车行业曾经的宠儿经历了漫长的滑坡。【原文：Nikola Corp. filed for bankruptcy, culminating a long slide for the onetime darling of the electric-vehicle industry, which struggled with weak sales and cycled through CEOs in the wake of a fraud scandal.】

item.title: 南非推迟预算，联盟分歧显现
item.description: 由于对年度预算的建议存在分歧，南非政府将年度预算的提交时间推迟到了下个月。【原文：South Africa’s government delayed the presentation of the annual budget until next month because of a disagreement over its proposals.】

item.title: 普拉达与顾问合作评估范思哲可能的竞购方案
item.description: 普拉达公司（Prada SpA）正在与顾问合作，对范思哲品牌进行评估，同时权衡对卡普里控股有限公司（Capri Holdings Ltd.）拥有的这家意大利时装公司的收购。【原文：Prada SpA is working with advisers to evaluate the Versace brand as it weighs a bid for the Italian fashion company owned by Capri Holdings Ltd.】

item.title: 盎格鲁黄金公司因价格创新高而在 2024 年实现 10 亿美元利润
item.description: 盎格鲁黄金阿散蒂有限公司（AngloGold Ashanti Ltd.）去年实现了 10 亿美元的利润，创纪录的金银价格帮助该矿商从 2023 年的亏损中反弹。【原文：AngloGold Ashanti Ltd. posted a $1 billion profit last year as record bullion prices helped the miner rebound from a loss in 2023.】

item.title: 柴油激增导致俄罗斯石油产品出口下降
item.description: 随着 1 月份柴油外流激增的势头减弱，俄罗斯本月的成品油出口量有所下降。【原文：Russia’s exports of refined products dropped this month as the surge in diesel outflows observed in January has subsided.】

item.title: Palantir 首席执行官呼吁技术爱国主义，警告人工智能战争
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，利泽特-查普曼（Lizette Chapman）撰文介绍 Palantir Technologies Inc.首席执行官亚历克斯-卡普（Alex Karp）的新书。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Lizette Chapman writes about a new book from Palantir Technologies Inc. Chief Executive Officer Alex Karp.】

item.title: 葡萄牙总理将在反对党帮助下击败譴责动议
item.description: 葡萄牙总理路易斯-黑山（Luis Montenegro）的少数派政府将获得包括社会党在内的反对党的支持，以挫败极右翼政党切加（Chega）宣布的谴责动议。【原文：Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s minority government will get backing from opposition parties including the Socialists to defeat a censure motion announced by far-right party Chega.】

item.title: 纳米比亚在近期钻探活动后降低了对石油的预期
item.description: 纳米比亚最近的几口勘探井未能为大约三年前开始的一连串发现锦上添花，因此纳米比亚对其长期石油前景持更加谨慎的态度。【原文：Namibia is taking a more cautious view on its long-term oil prospects after the latest exploration wells failed to add to a string of discoveries that started about three years ago.】

item.title: 中国公司减少对北美项目的投资
item.description: 去年年底，中国对北美的投资下降到了疫情最严重时期的水平以下，这一下滑是由美国的障碍造成的，而唐纳德-特朗普赢得大选前的观望态度很可能加剧了这一下滑。【原文：China’s investment into North America dropped at the end of last year below levels seen during the worst of the pandemic, a slump caused by hurdles in the US and likely exacerbated by a wait-and-see attitude ahead of the election won by Donald Trump.】
